text: Psalm 103
Thanksgiving for Yahweh’s Compassion
Of David.\f + \fr Ps 103 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Bless Yahweh, O my soul,
and all within me, \add bless\add* his holy name.
Bless Yahweh, O my soul,
and do not forget all his benefits:
who forgives all your iniquity,
who heals all your diseases,
who redeems your life from \add the\add* pit,
who crowns you with loyal love and mercies,
who satisfies your life with good
so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
Yahweh does deeds of justice
and judgments for all \add who\add* are oppressed,
\add who\add* made known his ways to Moses,
his deeds to the ⸤people⸥\f + \fr 103:7 \ft Literally “sons” \f* of Israel.
Yahweh \add is\add* compassionate and gracious,
⸤slow to anger⸥\f + \fr 103:8 \ft Literally “long of nostrils” \f* and abundant in loyal love.
He does not dispute continually,
nor keep \add his anger\add* forever.
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
nor repaid us according to our iniquities.
For as \add the\add* heavens are high above the earth,
\add so\add* his loyal love prevails over those who fear him.
As far as east \add is\add* from west,
\add so\add* he has removed far from us \add the guilt of\add* our transgressions.
As a father pities\f + \fr 103:13 \ft Or “shows compassion to” \f* \add his\add* children,
\add so\add* Yahweh pities\f + \fr 103:13 \ft Or “shows compassion to” \f* those who fear him.
For he knows our frame.\f + \fr 103:14 \ft That is, how we are formed \f*
He remembers that we \add are\add* dust.
As for man, his days \add are\add* like the grass.
As the flower of the field, so he blossoms.
When \add the\add* wind passes over it, it is no more,
and its place knows it no longer.
But the loyal love of Yahweh
\add is\add* from everlasting to everlasting on those who fear him,
and his righteousness to \add their\add* children’s children,
to those who keep his covenant
and remember to do his precepts.
Yahweh has established his throne in the heavens,
and his kingdom rules over all.
Bless Yahweh, you his angels,
\add you\add* mighty heroes who do his word
by ⸤obeying⸥\f + \fr 103:20 \ft Literally “hearing” \f* the sound of his word.
Bless Yahweh, all you his hosts,
\add you\add* his attendants who do his will.
Bless Yahweh, all his works,\f + \fr 103:22 \ft That is, created things \f*
in all the places of his dominion.
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.
